If he shoots 44 percent as a pro, he could be a stud. 30 percent? Could be a bust. A calculated risk for the Jazz.

The Pacers are swinging for the fences with this one. If he develops, it's a great pick for Indiana. But he also has the potential to be a Brandon Rush‑type of disappointment too.

analysis: Irving was the right choice for the Cavs. He's going to be a very good NBA point guard. He has very few flaws to his game. While he isn't great at one thing, there is almost no chance he fails. He might never be a superstar, but he plays a critical position and he'll help the Cavs right away. Derrick Williams would have been a good selection, too, but I think Irving was just less risky.

strengths: Excellent scoring efficiency • Strong physical profile • High offensive IQ
weaknesses: Defensive positioning concerns • Struggles against quicker SFs • Limited defensive rebounding
awards: Consensus second-team All-American ( 2011 ), Pac-10 Player of the Year ( 2011 ), 2× First-team All-Pac-10 ( 2010, 2011 ), Pac-10 Freshman of the Year (2010)
post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2012 ), Greek League All-Star (2022), Turkish Cup winner ( 2020 ), Turkish All-Star (2020), German BBL champion (2019)
analysis: The Timberwolves spent most of the day sending out strong signals that they were strongly considering Enes Kanter with this No. 2 pick, but GM David Kahn continued his strategy of “asset collection” by taking Derrick Williams. Williams is arguably the most talented player in this draft, as his inside-outside game will prove to be a match-up nightmare. However, with Michael Beasley and Anthony Randolph already on the roster (not to mention Kevin Love), don't be surprised to see a trade. Williams is efficient, explosive, and gifted. He's one of the few prospects in this draft with All-Star potential. citeturn1search4

strengths: Excellent size and diverse offensive skills • Strong rebounder with high basketball IQ • Positive attitude and strong work ethic
weaknesses: History of knee problems • Foot speed not elite • Somewhat inconsistent in high school
awards: FIBA Europe U18 Championship MVP ( 2009 ), Albert Schweitzer Tournament Most Talented Player (2008), WWE 24/7 Champion
analysis: The Jazz had a dilemma: draft for need or for talent? They needed a young point guard to eventually replace Deron Williams. But they felt like Kanter was the best talent on the board. It's a risky pick because Kanter is a mystery and no one knows how he will respond to the rigors of the NBA. But on paper, he's a terrific prospect and the Jazz center of the future to pair with the athletic Derrick Favors on the front line. They'll address other needs later on.

strengths: Tremendous wingspan and improved physique • Effective post positioning and rebounding • Quick and versatile defensive play
weaknesses: Limited outside shooting ability • Struggles against stronger defenders • Inconsistent energy and performance
awards: Second-team All- Big 12 (2011), Big 12 Freshman of the Year (2011), Second-team Parade All-American (2010), McDonald's All-American ( 2010 )
post draft awards: NBA champion ( 2016 ), NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2012 )
analysis: The Cavs do like Thompson. We began writing about this Wednesday, and one tip was that their analytics team loved him. He's one of the best offensive rebounders around and a good athlete with a great motor. Still, there's a chance they will move this pick. The Bobcats tried to move up and get him, and they talked to the Cavs about a deal. But if this is the Cavs' pick, I think it's a really good one.

strengths: Excellent rebounder with great size • High shooting efficiency and free-throw percentage • Strong defensive potential with shot-blocking ability
weaknesses: Struggles to create own offense • Prone to fouling due to aggressive play • Limited perimeter game and passing skills
awards: 2× FIBA Young Player of the Year (2011, LKL champion ( 2010 ), 2× LKL Most Improved Player ( 2011, 2× LKL blocks leader ( 2011, 2× All-LKL Team (2011, LKF Cup winner (2010), 2× LKL All-Star Game MVP ( 2011, 5× Lithuanian Player of the Year (2011, FIBA Under-19 World Cup MVP (2011)
post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2013 ), 2012), All-EuroCup First Team (2012), EuroCup Rising Star ( 2012 ), 2012 ), LKL MVP ( 2012 ), LKL Domestic Player of the Year (2012), 2012 ), 2012), 3x All-LKL Defensive Team (2010–2012), 3× LKL All-Star ( 2010 – 2012 ), 2012 ), All-VTB United League First Team (2012), VTB United League rebounding leader ( 2012 ), VTB United League blocks leader (2012), 2012, 2014, 2017, 2021)
analysis: The Raptors know international players, and they might feel that they finally have found a real center. He's a true low-post player with a good motor, and he's tough -- basically the opposite of Andrea Bargnani. But this could be a pick that gets traded -- the Cavs have been all over Valanciunas for weeks. We'll see. Also, it will take a while to truly grade this pick for the Raptors, as it's unlikely Valanciunas will come over this year.

strengths: Excellent size and length for position • Improved post-up and shooting skills • Strong transition scorer and defender
weaknesses: Needs better offensive consistency • Must improve strength and rebounding • Limited ball-handling and 1-on-1 skills
awards: 3× ABA League champion ( 2009 – 2011 ), 3× Serbian League champion ( 2009 – 2011 ), 3× Serbian Cup winner ( 2009 –2011), FIBA European Young Player of the Year (2010)

analysis: The Wizards have been focused on Vesely for months. He's an elite athlete who flies up and down the floor and loves to dunk the basketball. Washington thinks he is a great fit in an up-tempo offense with John Wall and JaVale McGee. He should be really fun to watch.

strengths: Explosive with terrific wingspan • Strong defensive potential • High motor and intensity
weaknesses: Offensive skills underdeveloped • Needs better rebounding technique • Limited basketball knowledge and awareness
analysis: Biyombo came out of nowhere to be a top-seven pick. He was starting to slide after a subpar workout at the Eurocamp. But he came to the U.S., started working out against other players and wowed teams everywhere he went. Biyombo has a great motor, and he's tough. He will be able to rebound and block shots. I think he's a safer pick than people realize.

strengths: Explosive scorer with NBA range • Great size and quickness • Smart, unselfish playmaker
weaknesses: Needs to improve ball handling • Prone to turnovers • Inconsistent shooting efficiency
awards: First-team All- SEC (2011), SEC All-Freshman Team (2011), Gatorade High School Athlete of the Year (2010), 2× Gatorade National Player of the Year (2009, 2010), First-team Parade All-American (2010), Second-team Parade All-American (2009), McDonald's All-American ( 2010 ), 2× Florida Mr. Basketball (2009, 2010)
post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie First Team ( 2012 ), BSN Most Valuable Player (2023), BSN scoring champion (2023)
analysis: Do the Pistons need yet another combo guard? They clearly wanted to go big and thought they'd get Tristan Thompson or Bismack Biyombo. But with Knight sliding to No. 8, the Pistons felt they had to take the best talent available. He has major upside, is a great teammate, works hard and plays defense. The Pistons can move Rodney Stuckey to the 2, and they'll be fine. Barring a trade, they'll have to find another big man some other time.

strengths: Explosive speed and quickness • Creative scorer and playmaker • Strong rebounder for size
weaknesses: Struggles with size limitations • Prone to playing out of control • Inconsistent shooting efficiency
awards: NCAA champion ( 2011 ), NCAA Final Four Most Outstanding Player ( 2011 ), Consensus First-team All-American ( 2011 ), Lute Olson Award (2011), Bob Cousy Award (2011), First-team All-Big East (2011), Third-team All-Big East (2010), Big East tournament MVP ( 2011 ), Second-team Parade All-American (2008), McDonald's All-American ( 2008 )

analysis: The Bobcats have never been sold on D.J. Augustin. Walker is a warrior and a winner, and Michael Jordan loves that. The Bobcats are getting a lot tougher in this draft, bringing in a really nice balance of defense and scoring. This is a really good pick for Charlotte.

strengths: Led nation in scoring • Excellent shooting and range • High basketball IQ and work ethic
weaknesses: Poor defensive skills • Below average athleticism for NBA • Struggles with assist-to-turnover ratio

analysis: Jimmer! Do we really have to say anything else? He'll be a very popular pick in Sacramento. The Kings' starting point was Beno Udrih, and Fredette has the ability to be much better. He's a great shooter, and he's tough. I think it's a really good pick, and Fredette, Tyreke Evans and Marcus Thornton will be a fun backcourt to watch.

strengths: Elite shooting ability with deep range • Good size and wingspan for NBA 2-guard • High basketball IQ and solid decision maker

awards: 2× First-team All-Pac-10 ( 2010 , 2011 ), No. 1 retired by Washington State Cougars
post draft awards: 4× NBA champion ( 2015, 2017, 2018, 2022 ), 5× NBA All-Star ( 2015 – 2019 ), 2× All-NBA Third Team ( 2015, 2016 ), NBA All-Defensive Second Team ( 2019 ), NBA Three-Point Contest champion ( 2016 ), NBA All-Rookie First Team ( 2012 )
analysis: New Warriors exec Jerry West tipped this one weeks ago. Thompson is a very good shooter, and that will be his staple in the NBA. But he's also skilled as a ball handler and passer, and he has a high basketball IQ. The question is, what does this mean for Monta Ellis?

strengths: NBA size with point guard skills • Excellent finisher and free throw shooter • Versatile scorer and defender
weaknesses: Needs to improve three-point shooting • Lacks physical strength • Struggles defensively against quick guards
awards: First-team All- Big 12 (2011), Big 12 Freshman of the Year (2010), Big 12 All-Rookie Team (2010)
analysis: The Jazz believe Burks has the ability to get to the basket at will. Watch the tape, and you'll see why. With his athleticism and aggressiveness as a scorer as well as his passing ability, some believe he can be a Brandon Roy type of guard down the road.

strengths: Strong finisher around the rim • Efficient perimeter shooter • High rebound and block rates
weaknesses: Lacks mid-range game • Limited dribbling skills • Struggles to draw fouls
awards: Second-team All- Big 12 (2011)
post draft awards: NBA champion ( 2020 )
analysis: The Suns have said they will emphasize defense. Morris is a good move in that direction -- a solid rebounder who can stretch the floor, which coach Alvin Gentry will appreciate. People laughed when NBA scouts said in February that Markieff could go ahead of his twin brother. As the draft got closer, scouts got comfortable that Markieff has a position, while they aren't sure Marcus does.

strengths: Versatile scoring ability • Excellent jumpshot with range • Strong post maneuvers
weaknesses: Limited defensive impact • Lacks explosiveness and length • Subpar free throw shooting
awards: Consensus second-team All-American ( 2011 ), Big 12 Player of the Year ( 2011 ), First-team All- Big 12 (2011), Big 12 All-Rookie Team (2009), No. 22 jersey retired by Kansas Jayhawks
analysis: Is Morris a small forward? If he is, I can see the fit. If he's an undersized power forward, he sure looks a lot like Luis Scola and Chuck Hayes, doesn't he? Let's not forget, though, the Rockets are always wheeling and dealing.

strengths: Hybrid forward with terrific length • Improved shooter, respectable outside threat • Strong rebounder with great timing
weaknesses: Inconsistent jumpshot with flat trajectory • Lacks polished skills for perimeter play • Overly aggressive on defense, prone to mistakes
awards: NBA 75th Anniversary Team, Consensus second-team All-American ( 2011 ), 2× First-team All- MWC (2010, 2011), No. 15 retired by San Diego State Aztecs, California Mr. Basketball (2009)

analysis: The Pacers selected Leonard for the San Antonio Spurs, a source says. In return, the Pacers will get guard George Hill, a local product. For the Spurs, this is a great pick. I had Leonard ranked at No. 7 on my board, after watching him and hearing from people around the league. He is versatile, has a great motor, is a good defender and is an emerging offensive player.

strengths: Great size and offensive skills • Effective in post and face-up game • Solid rebounder and free throw shooter

awards: AP honorable mention All-American ( 2011 ), First-team All-Pac-10 ( 2011 ), Second-team All-Pac-10 ( 2010 )

analysis: The Sixers wanted size and got the biggest player in the draft. Vucevic is huge and skilled. I doubt he'll become a star, but he's going to be solid on both ends of the floor.

strengths: Ideal size and athleticism for guard • Strong, explosive, and fast in transition • Excellent defender with high rebounding ability
weaknesses: Inconsistent and lacks discipline • Poor shot selection and jump shooting • Prone to flashy, turnover-inducing plays

analysis: I'm a little surprised the Knicks passed on Chris Singleton to get Shumpert. Both are great defenders, and I guess the Knicks felt they needed a perimeter defender more. He is a great athlete, and can play both the 1 and the 2. He could develop into a good point guard, but he's going to be a project.

strengths: Explosive leaper with elite athleticism • Formidable catch and shoot threat • Lockdown defender across multiple positions
weaknesses: Lacks natural ballhandling skills • Streaky shooter with awkward form • Poor footwork and body control inside

analysis: The Wizards continue to add size and athleticism with Singleton, the best defender in the draft. Period. He's strong and physical, and he can guard three or four positions. The Wizards are adding athletes and toughness to this team -- I really like their draft.

strengths: Versatile with strong ball handling • Excellent touch around the basket • High basketball IQ and work ethic
weaknesses: Undersized for power forward position • Inconsistent shooting range • Lacks explosiveness and foot speed
awards: Second-team Freshman All-American (2011), Second-team All- SEC (2011), SEC All-Freshman Team (2011), McDonald's All-American (2010), First-team Parade All-American (2010), Mr. New York Basketball (2010)
analysis: The Bobcats selected Harris for the Bucks. Harris is the sleeper of the draft. He won't be a superstar, but he reminds me a lot of Shane Battier. He's versatile, with a high basketball IQ. While he could be a better athlete, he's a great value at 19.

strengths: Excellent offensive versatility • Good ball handling for size • Effective in pick and roll/pop
weaknesses: Needs to improve defensive engagement • Inconsistent rebounding effort • Struggles with physical strength in post
awards: EuroCup Rising Star ( 2011 ), Lithuanian League All-Star ( 2009 ), Lithuanian League Most Improved Player (2009), Lithuanian National Basketball League champion (2008), Lithuanian Cup winner (2008), Baltic League champion (2008), FIBA Europe Under-18 Championship MVP ( 2008 ), Nike International Junior Tournament MVP (2007)

analysis: The Wolves will send Motiejunas and Jonny Flynn to the Rockets for the No. 23 pick, a future first-round pick and Brad Miller. The Rockets get yet another power forward. Motiejunas is a scorer and a very smooth one. He's not much of a rebounder and he needs to get tougher, but he's one of the most polished big man scorers in Europe. A good value here.

strengths: High basketball IQ and decision making • Good size and versatility for a guard • Efficient offensive playmaker
weaknesses: Struggles with creating separation • Not a dynamic athlete • Defensive limitations against NBA 2 guards
awards: NCAA champion ( 2010 ), Consensus first-team All-American ( 2011 ), ACC Player of the Year (2011), First-team All-ACC (2011), Second-team All-ACC (2010), ACC All-Defensive Team (2011), McDonald's All-American ( 2007 ), First-team Parade All-American (2007)
post draft awards: Croatian League champion (2014), Croatian Cup champion (2014), Croatian League All-Star (2014)
analysis: This feels like the first true reach of the night. Smith can be a solid player. He's versatile enough to play both backcourt positions. But most scouts think his ceiling is as a great sixth man off the bench. Maybe at this point in the draft, that's good enough. I thought Kenneth Faried would have been a better pick here.

strengths: Dominant rebounder and interior defender • Explosive athleticism and energy • Improving offensive skills
weaknesses: Undersized for NBA power forward • Limited offensive versatility • Poor free throw shooter
awards: Consensus second-team All-American ( 2011 ), NABC Defensive Player of the Year (2011), NCAA rebounding leader (2011), 2× OVC Player of the Year (2010, 2011), 3× OVC Defensive Player of the Year (2009–2011), 3× First-team All-OVC (2009–2011)
post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie First Team ( 2012 )
analysis: The Nuggets get one of my favorite players in the draft. Faried is a relentless rebounder, with a crazy amount of energy. He doesn't score but he could lead the league in rebounding someday. It's fun to think about him and Chris Andersen on the floor together, with their similar styles of play.

strengths: Versatile offensive skill set • Good shot selection and clutch performer • Effective in pick and roll defense
weaknesses: Needs additional strength • Limited athleticism for NBA • Struggles against powerful opponents
awards: 2× EuroLeague Rising Star (2011, FIBA U20 EuroBasket MVP ( 2011 )
post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie First Team ( 2015 ), EuroLeague MVP ( 2022 ), 2× All-Euroleague First Team ( 2021, 2022 ), 3× All-Euroleague Second Team ( 2013, 2014, 2023 ), EuroLeague Final Four Top Scorer ( 2022 ), 2012), Lega Serie A champion ( 2024 ), Italian Supercup winner (2024), Lega Serie A Finals MVP ( 2024 ), 3× Liga ACB champion ( 2013, 2021, 2023 ), 4× Spanish Cup winner ( 2012, 2014, 2021, 2022 ), 2× Spanish Supercup winner ( 2012, 2013 ), 2× Catalan League champion (2019, 2022), 2× Liga ACB MVP ( 2013, 2020 ), 2× Liga ACB Finals MVP ( 2021, 2023 ), 4× All-Liga ACB First Team (2013, 2014, 2020, 2021), 2× All-Liga ACB Second Team (2022, 2023), 5× Liga ACB Domestic Player of the Year (2013, 2020–2023), Liga ACB three-point field goal percentage leader (2021), 2× Catalan League MVP (2019, 2020), 2× Spanish Cup MVP (2014, 2022 ), Spanish Supercup MVP ( 2013 )
analysis: Actually, the Bulls are getting Mirotic here. The Rockets selected for the Timberwolves as part of the Flynn-Motiejunas trade. Then the Wolves turned around and sent No. 23 to Chicago for No. 28, No. 43 and cash. I like this pick -- Mirotic reminds me a bit of Toni Kukoc. He won't be coming over for a few years because of contract issues, but he's already playing at a high level in Europe. A good, long-term pick.

strengths: Explosive athleticism and quickness • Improved 3-point shooting to 42% • Effective in pick and roll situations
weaknesses: Not a true point guard • Slow jump shot release • Struggles against top competition
awards: First-team All-ACC (2011), Mr. Colorado Basketball (2008)
post draft awards: NBA champion ( 2023 )
analysis: Jackson hasn't worked out for one team. Didn't do physicals. No interviews or psych tests. And he still goes No. 24. The Heat are bummed. They shut him down to keep him out of the first round, but it didn't work. It's a great pick for the Thunder. He's long and athletic, and he can shoot the basketball. A very underrated player. Does this mean Eric Maynor is on his way out?

strengths: Increased scoring each year at Providence • Excellent size and length for shooting guard • Capable of creating his own shot
weaknesses: Tendency for ball-dominant play • Questionable shot selection • Lacks elite athleticism and strength
awards: Third-team All-American – AP ( 2011 ), First-team All-Big East (2011)
post draft awards: CBA International MVP (2021), CBA All Import Player First Team (2021), CBA All-Star (2017), NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2012 )
analysis: The Celtics selected Brooks on behalf of the Nets in return for the 27th pick and a future second-rounder. This is a very good pick for New Jersey. The Nets needed a scorer at the 2, and at this point in the draft, this is a great pick. Brooks is the best scorer left on the board. He has the tools to be great.

strengths: Confident, versatile scorer • Strong rebounder and passer • Excellent shooting mechanics
weaknesses: Inconsistent shooting streaks • Below average lateral quickness • Tends to take ill-advised shots
awards: Consensus second-team All-American ( 2011 ), First-team All- Big 12 (2011)
post draft awards: FIBA South American Basketball League champion (2017), Dominican Republic Basketball League champion (2017), All-Dominican Republic Basketball League Second Team (2017), Venezuelan Basketball League champion (2017), NBA D-League All-Star (2015)
analysis: The Mavs selected Hamilton for the Nuggets as part of a larger Andre Miller-Raymond Felton trade. The Mavs will get Rudy Fernandez in return. The Nuggets are loaded at small forward with Danilo Gallinari and Wilson Chandler (if he stays). Not sure why they feel they need another gunslinger. But I do think Hamilton is a great value here.

strengths: Athletic shot‑blocking forward • Reliable mid‑range jumper • Runs floor hard in transition
weaknesses: Needs added strength • Limited ball handling • Inconsistent motor
awards: Consensus first-team All-American ( 2011 ), Pete Newell Big Man Award (2011), Big Ten Player of the Year (2011), Big Ten Defensive Player of the Year (2011), 2× First-team All- Big Ten (2009, 2011), Second-team All-Big Ten (2010), 3× Big Ten All-Defensive team (2009–2011)

analysis: The Nets selected Johnson for the Celtics. Boston gets a really nice player in Johnson, who is long and athletic and was productive in his four years. While some scouts think he's soft, perhaps Kevin Garnett can toughen him up. If so, he's a steal here.

strengths: Excellent leadership and playmaking skills • Strong defensive abilities and quickness • High free throw accuracy and rebounding
weaknesses: Lacks standout skills • Physically underwhelming for the NBA • Inconsistent shooting performance
awards: Horizon League Player of the Year (2011), Horizon League Defensive Player of the Year (2011)
post draft awards: 2× NBA champion ( 2012, 2013 ), Pro A champion (2021), French Cup winner (2021), French League All-Star (2020), Israeli League champion ( 2018 ), Israeli League Cup winner ( 2017 ), Montenegrin Cup winner (2019), All-FIBA AmeriCup Team ( 2022 ), No. 30 retired by Cleveland State Vikings
analysis: The Bulls sent this pick to the Wolves, who then sent it to the Heat. Actually, this pick was originally held by the Heat and sent to the Raptors as part of the Chris Bosh trade. It's come back around. The Heat were hoping to get Reggie Jackson, but in fact, I have had Cole ranked higher on my board. If he had played at a school such as Duke, he'd have gone much higher. As a pure point guard with NBA quicks, I think he's an upgrade over Mario Chalmers.

strengths: Ideal size and wingspan for NBA guard • Strong perimeter shooting skills • Solid defender with potential
weaknesses: Lacks experience as a true point guard • Struggles with interior scoring • Needs to develop playmaking skills
awards: Big 12 All-Freshman team (2011), McDonald's All-American ( 2010 ), First-team Parade All-American (2010)
post draft awards: NBA champion ( 2014 ), All-NBA D-League Second Team (2013), All-NBA D-League Defensive Second Team (2013)
analysis: The Spurs surprised us a bit with the Joseph pick. He's more of a scorer and not a great athlete, but he sort of reminds me of George Hill. Joseph is now Hill's heir apparent after the team shipped Hill to the Pacers for the 15th pick.

strengths: Great in transition and finishing plays • Effective without dominating the ball • Strong defender and rebounder
weaknesses: Lacks standout skills • Struggles with self-created offense • Needs to improve shooting range
post draft awards: 6× NBA All-Star ( 2015 – 2018, 2020, 2022 ), All-NBA Second Team ( 2023 ), 4× All-NBA Third Team ( 2017, 2018, 2020, 2021 ), 5× NBA All-Defensive Second Team ( 2014 – 2016, 2018, 2021 ), NBA Eastern Conference Finals MVP ( 2023 ), NBA Most Improved Player ( 2015 ), NBA steals leader ( 2021 )
analysis: Butler will be the consummate NBA role player. He can defend multiple positions, doesn't need the ball to be effective and plays hard all of the time. He has a chance to be a very good player off the bench for the Bulls. Plus, he has one of the most amazing stories of anyone in the draft. Check it out.

strengths: Elite spot‑up shooter • Crafty off‑ball mover • Tough in clutch situations
weaknesses: Average lateral quickness • Streaky defender focus • Limited playmaking
place of birth: Mostar , SR Bosnia and Herzegovina , SFR Yugoslavia
awards: Croatian League champion (2010), Croatian Cup champion (2009), All-Croatian League First Team (2011), Croatian League All-Star (2010), Croatian League All-Domestic Players Team (2011)

analysis: The Heat sent this to the Wolves for the 28th pick, and then the Wolves sold it to the Nets. Bogdanovic was the second-leading scorer in the Euroleague this year, so he can play. But his contract will keep him from coming to the NBA for at least the next two years.

strengths: Excellent shooter with NBA range • Agile and quick for his size • Effective in pick and pop situations
weaknesses: Lacks a true defensive position • Needs to improve physical strength • Questionable competition level at Richmond
awards: First-team All- Atlantic 10 (2011)
post draft awards: 2× NBA D-League All-Star (2016, 2017)
analysis: The Magic get this pick from the Cavs for two future second-rounders. I really like this pick for the Magic. Harper is one of the best-shooting big men in the draft. Scouts compared him to Rashard Lewis all season.

strengths: High basketball IQ and decision-making • Effective jump shooter with good size • Competitive and understands his role
weaknesses: Below average athleticism and quickness • Inconsistent shooting and finishing ability • Struggles defensively, especially laterally
awards: NCAA champion ( 2010 ), NCAA Final Four Most Outstanding Player ( 2010 ), Second-team All-American – NABC ( 2011 ), 2× First-team All-ACC (2010, 2011), Second-team All-ACC (2009), Third-team All-ACC (2008), ACC Rookie of the Year (2008), McDonald's All-American ( 2007 ), First-team Parade All-American (2007), Second-team Parade All-American (2006)

analysis: The Pistons went for toughness at No. 33. Singler has struggled with his shot and lacks a clear position, but he's one of the toughest guys out there. One scout said he could be an Andres Nocioni type of player in the future.

strengths: Instant offense with composed play • Strong physical build and defensive skills • Excellent shooter with good shot creation
weaknesses: Below average point guard vision and passing • Lacks elite athleticism and speed • Inexperienced as a primary point guard

post draft awards: Greek League champion ( 2021 ), Greek Cup winner ( 2021 ), Israeli State Cup winner ( 2020 ), NBA Development League All-Star (2013)
analysis: I like Mack. He's tough, he can shoot a bit, and he can play the 1 and the 2. Nice player coming off the bench.

strengths: Extremely versatile and athletic wing • Excellent defender with shot-blocking ability • Strong rebounder despite thin frame
weaknesses: Struggles with creating own shot • Inconsistent scorer and shooter • Needs to improve strength and bulk
awards: First-team All-Pac-10 ( 2011 ), Pac-10 All-Freshman team ( 2010 ), Third-team Parade All-American (2009)
post draft awards: EuroCup champion ( 2015 ), BSL Slam Dunk Contest champion (2017), NBA D-League champion (2013)
analysis: The Kings were looking for a small forward and get a steal with Honeycutt. Had he stayed in school for another year, he could have been a solid first-round pick. Very good value here. He has a high basketball IQ and can really pass it. Plus, UCLA players always seem to do better in the NBA. I like this pick for the Kings.

strengths: Improved conditioning and agility • Versatile in various court roles • Strong rebounder with great hands
weaknesses: Struggles against taller defenders • Inconsistent jump shot and free throws • Needs better awareness of double teams
analysis: Williams is tough and an excellent rebounder, but he's undersized for his position. Still, the Nets needed help here.

strengths: Versatile low-post game with strong footwork • Effective catch and shoot player • Unselfish, finds open teammates when double-teamed
weaknesses: Below average leaping ability • Poor lateral movement limits defense • Conditioning and motor are concerns
awards: First-team All- SEC (2010), Third-team Parade All-American (2008)

analysis: The Clippers get one of the most talented scoring big men in the draft. But his conditioning issues and lack of toughness caused him to drop.

weaknesses: Not very aggressive as a scorer • Average athleticism and defender • Poor free-throw shooter

post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2012 )
analysis: Parsons is super-skilled for a big guy, sort of an athletic point forward. He wasn't always tough enough at Florida, but he worked out really well. If he plays tougher in the pros, he has enough talent to succeed.

strengths: NBA size with good coordination • Solid post game potential • Effective rebounding ability
weaknesses: Inconsistent offensive efficiency • Low basketball IQ and decision-making • Maturity and character concerns

analysis: The Warriors wanted Bismack Biyombo, and Tyler is a poor man's Biyombo -- big, athletic and a good defender, but still raw offensively. Like Biyombo, he's a mystery because he's done almost all his work overseas, in Israel and Japan, after leaving high school in California.

strengths: Averaged 15 points, solid outside shooter • Excellent footwork and post moves • High basketball IQ, efficient defender

awards: AP Honorable mention All-American ( 2011 ), First-team All- Big Ten – Coaches (2011), Second-team All-Big Ten – Media (2011)
analysis: Leuer stays close to home. He's big and a very good shooter -- he can really spread the floor. If he were a better rebounder, he'd have gone higher.

analysis: Morris might be the purest point guard in the draft. He sees the floor well and has great size. If he learns to shoot a little, he can be a poor man's Andre Miller.

awards: Slovenian Cup winner (2011)
post draft awards: ABA League champion ( 2013 ), 3× Serbian League champion ( 2012 – 2014 ), Serbian Cup winner ( 2012 )
analysis: The Spurs got this pick from the Pacers in the Kawhi Leonard trade. Bertans is just 18 and a crazy good shooter. San Antonio fell in love with him at the adidas Eurocamp. Very good value here. This is a great draft for the Spurs.

analysis: The Bulls will send this pick to the Timberwolves. Minnesota was looking at Lee at No. 20, so he has great value here. He's one of the best perimeter defenders in the draft, and he can play both guard positions -- and the Wolves really need perimeter defense.

analysis: The Knicks bought this pick from the Hornets. The Knicks need size, and Harrellson has that. But he's a pretty big project, too. I doubt coach Mike D'Antoni will give him minutes. Then again, lacking big men, D'Antoni might not have a choice.

analysis: Selby slid, in part because of some medical concerns that came out of the NBA draft combine. But this is a great pick by the Grizzlies. He has a ton of talent, and at this point in the draft, there is no risk. If he gets healthy and works hard, he can make it out of the second round the same way Monta Ellis and Lou Williams did.

I saw him in Orlando when the Morris twins were working out, and it was clear he is long, athletic and a major project.

place of birth: [ disputed ] Brazzaville , People's Republic of the Congo
analysis: This pick will go to the Timberwolves. International scout Pete Philo found him in Qatar. Ngombo is a guy virtually no one knew a week ago, and then his name leaked a few days ago. He's a good athlete and a scorer. If you watched the draft telecast, you saw the game film that gave a new definition to grainy.

analysis: Sudanese-born Australian Ater Majok has a shot at basketball's big time after being drafted by NBA glamour club Los Angeles Lakers. The former refugee, who settled with his family in Sydney, was selected with the 58th overall pick by the Lakers. The 208cm tall Majok was the last of the Lakers' four second-round picks, so he is likely to be seen as a development project. But at least he gets to push his claims for future court time alongside the likes of superstar Kobe Bryant. citeturn7search9

analysis: Another foreign player who will need a couple of years to develop, Adam Hanga wasn't on many draft radars until recent weeks when some mock drafts slipped him into the late second round. He is currently playing for Basquet Manresa in Spain's Liga ACB. Hanga is a tweener, with scouts unsure whether he'll grow into a small forward in the NBA or if he'll be stuck as a tall shooting guard. He has shown the ability to create his own offense, with solid athleticism and quickness. He'll need to continue to develop his jump shot and, like several other players on this list, his defense needs work. A long-term development project, you would have liked to see more all-around game potential from him. The chances he becomes a productive NBA player are slim, so the Spurs would be better off drafting somebody who could give them a couple of minutes off the bench right now. citeturn9view0

He is efficient, is a great shooter, gets to the rim and plays hard. He needs to improve his court vision, but he's a hard worker, I think he'll get better and better. -- Chad Ford

analysis: I think this is where the reward starts to outweigh the risk for the Pistons in terms of taking Drummond. And he winds up in a perfect situation in Detroit. The Pistons need a shot-blocker and rebounder in the paint to pair with Greg Monroe. Drummond is a project, but he has as much upside as anyone else in the draft other than Anthony Davis. The question, and it's a real one, is whether he'll reach it. -- Chad Ford

strengths: Dynamic scorer with NBA range • Excels in isolation and pick-and-roll • Solid size and quickness for guard positions
weaknesses: Highly ball-dominant, needs tailored team • Lacks vision as a primary facilitator • Defensive effort usually underwhelming

I'm not sold on Austin Rivers, but Williams is a great coach and will put him in a position to succeed. I'm not sure how exactly he fits with Eric Gordon, but some are sold they can play together. -- Chad Ford

strengths: Athletic 7-footer with good length • Strong body control and finishing ability • Effective rim protector and rebounder

I think this is a bit high for Marshall, but the Suns definitely have filled a need if Nash leaves. -- Chad Ford

But at this point in the draft he's a no-brainer pick and a great get for the Thunder. He's long and athletic and he should thrive in their system. Great pick at 28. -- Chad Ford

analysis: Love this pick for the Kings. McLemore is a great shooter and an elite athlete. He is a potential star down the road. While I understand him falling a little, this was too far. The Kings needed shooting and athleticism in their backcourt and they got it.

strengths: Fearless leader with consistent scoring • Excels in clutch situations and playmaking • Strong defensive anticipation and physicality

strengths: Elite scoring versatility • Efficient in isolation and pick & roll • Strong under pressure

weaknesses: Inconsistent outside shooting • Prone to turnovers • Character concerns from past incident

analysis: The Sixers traded Jrue Holiday to land Nerlens Noel and then replaced Holiday with Carter-Williams here. Like Noel, Carter-Williams was ranked highly by analytic measures -- MCW is one of the top guards in the draft by advanced metrics and gives Philly size and a pure point guard to throw up lobs for Noel. Add in the 2014 first-round pick they got from the Pelicans (1-to-5 protected) and I think the Sixers came away with a great haul on draft night. Clearly they are going in full rebuild mode and will try to get a high pick in next year's stellar draft.

strengths: Strong defensive presence and rebounder • High energy and coachable • Expanding offensive skills
weaknesses: Limited basketball experience • Inconsistent offensive moves • Poor free throw shooter

post draft awards: NBA All-Rookie Second Team ( 2014 )
analysis: Steven Adams is all about potential. He has great size, and he's a good athlete. He's already a terrific defender. What Adams doesn't have yet is an offensive game. He's a project but with a pretty big upside.

strengths: Highly effective post scorer • Excellent understanding and IQ • Strong rebounder and shooter
weaknesses: Below average athleticism • Struggles against elite athletes • Limited shot blocking ability

analysis: The Mavs traded this pick to the Celtics for the No. 16 pick and two future second-round picks. The Celtics have had their eyes on Olynyk for a while. He's a stretch 4 who thrives catching the ball on the high post and driving to the basket. I'm not in love with Olynyk, but clearly he will be a big part of the rebuilding process in Boston.

strengths: Fierce competitor with scoring ability • Uses length effectively on offense • Strong work ethic and clutch performer
weaknesses: Struggles creating shots off the dribble • Defensive skills and awareness lacking • Relies too heavily on left hand
awards: Second-team All-American – SN ( 2013 ), First-team All-Pac-12 ( 2013 ), Pac-12 co-Freshman of the Year (2013), Naismith Prep Player of the Year (2012), Mr. Basketball USA (2012), McDonald's All-American Game MVP ( 2012 ), First-team Parade All-American (2012)
analysis: The Jazz traded this pick along with the 21st pick to Minnesota for the draft rights to Trey Burke. President of basketball operations Flip Saunders has been a fan of Muhammad for some time. He wanted a scorer on the wings, and Muhammad is talented at putting the ball in the hoop. However, I feel like the Jazz really needed a shooter. Muhammad is good with his feet set, but he doesn't shoot well off the dribble. It will be interesting to see what they do at No. 21.

strengths: Freakish length and agility • Elite transition ball‑handler • Tremendous defensive versatility

analysis: The Bucks decided to swing for the fences with Antetokounmpo. He looks a little like Kevin Durant. He can handle the ball, he can shoot the 3, and he's got a crazy wingspan. But he has Q-tips for legs, has been playing in the equivalent of a rec league in Greece and looks years away from being NBA ready. He will be a home run or a bust, but we won't know which for a couple of years.

strengths: High level athlete with exceptional size • Shows potential in midrange game • Solid rebounder with quick feet

analysis: The Hawks will send this pick to the Mavs. The Mavs were looking for a point guard with Darren Collison heading into free agency. Larkin is small, but he's an elite athlete, plays the pick-and-roll very well and can really shoot the ball. If he were a little bigger or longer, he would've gone much higher. He's a solid pick here for the Mavs.

analysis: The Cavs have coveted Karasev for a while and he fills an immediate need for them at small forward. Karasev is a fantastic shooter with deep range. He's also a great ball handler with a terrific basketball IQ. He's going to be able to step in and help right away. Great pick for the Cavs.

strengths: Picturesque shooting stroke with NBA range • Intriguing size and defensive abilities • Efficient in catch and shoot situations

analysis: The Bulls wanted a shooter, but I wonder about Snell. With other shooters such as Allen Crabbe and Reggie Bullock left on the board, I think there were safer picks than Snell. Snell is intriguing, but he was very inconsistent at New Mexico. He was sort of a workout wonder. Don't love this pick.

analysis: The Jazz sent the No. 21 pick to the Wolves to complete the Trey Burke trade. Dieng is an interesting pick. He's old and not very polished -- two major red flags. But he is a good shot blocker and rebounder and a good passer from the high post. Yes, he's a project, but he's still intriguing because he got such a late start in the game.

strengths: Big forward with NBA-level athleticism • Experienced, high-energy player • Strong rebounder and leaper
weaknesses: Limited offensive skills • Predictable, mechanical post game • Lacks defensive prowess and adaptability

analysis: For the second straight year, I'm incredulous of whom the Pacers selected in the 20s. Last year it was Miles Plumlee, a huge reach at No. 26. This year they reached even further with Hill at No. 23. Hill was ranked No. 79 on our Big Board. He was a good college player and very experienced. He's a jack-of-all-trades, and I'm sure the Pacers think he can help right now. But they thought the same thing about Plumlee and Orlando Johnson last year, and it didn't work out well.

strengths: Proficient three-point shooter • Excellent in transition • Solid decision maker

analysis: The Knicks added a little name recognition by taking Tim Hardaway Jr. He's a polished scorer who can shoot the basketball and he has size for his position. I don't think he has tremendous upside, but he is ready to play right now. A solid pick for the Knicks.

analysis: The Clippers were looking for a shooter and in Bullock landed one of the best in the draft. He has unlimited range on his jumper, has good size for his position and is a solid defender. This was a nice pick for a team that's going to try to compete for a championship.

strengths: Premier rebounder with high energy • Versatile defender, effective in paint • Improved passer, sets strong screens

analysis: This pick went from the Wolves to the Warriors to the Thunder. Roberson was a stats-geek star. Our own Kevin Pelton ranked him as the third-best prospect in the draft based on his WARP model. Roberson is a bit of a tweener, but he's one of the best rebounders in the draft. Once again the Thunder try to prove they're smarter than the rest of us.

strengths: Exceptional wingspan and mobility • Reliable hook shot and solid touch • Effective rim protector with good timing
weaknesses: Needs to increase upper body strength • Limited offensive range and fluidity • Lacks competitive fire and game awareness

His calling card is being a huge rim protector. While he isn't a great athlete and he hasn't quite figured things out as a player, as a project he's worth the pick here.

strengths: Excels as high-energy, versatile defender • Strong slasher and mid-range scorer • Agile with excellent open-floor speed

analysis: Livio Jean-Charles was the breakout star at the Nike Hoop Summit. Jean-Charles exploded with 27 points, 13 rebounds, two steals and two blocks. He clearly was the MVP of the World Team, doing the little things that impress scouts all week. He's long, athletic, has a nose for the ball and can score both inside and on the midrange jumper. The Spurs think he'll spend another year in France before he comes to the NBA. A nice pick here.

John Calipari compared him to a young Russell Westbrook -- he's an elite athlete and a creative finisher. If he could hit a jump shot, he would've gone much higher. If the Suns are patient, this could really pay off.

analysis: Nedovic is not your typical European guard. Nedovic is a superathletic combo guard with an explosive 41-inch vertical. He's playing major minutes in Lithuania this year for BC Lietuvos rytas and averaged 10 PPG and 2.1 APG in Euroleague play this season. While his game still appears to be trapped between a one and two, there's no question he has the athletic ability and the requisite aggressiveness on offense to play in the NBA. The Warriors plan on bringing him to Summer League and see if he can make the league.

strengths: Lethal spot-up shooter with great range • Excellent on-ball defender with good length • Moves well without the ball

It's another steal for the Thunder.

strengths: High basketball IQ and good passer • Strong and athletic with a 40 inch vertical • Effective scorer and rebounder for his position

analysis: The Kings wanted a point guard, and McCallum is one of the purest point guards in the draft. He's not the sexiest pick, but he's a steady floor leader who is very unselfish. If the Kings clean house, McCallum could end up playing a lot of minutes.

analysis: The Pistons got a huge steal in Mitchell. He's long, athletic and really rebounds. He struggled as a primary offensive option at North Texas, but as a role player -- on a team like the Pistons -- he's a really great fit. He had lottery talent, so he's a great pick here.

I love Wolters; he was the Jimmer Fredette of college basketball this year, but because he was at South Dakota State, few got to see him play. He's a true point guard who also can really score the basketball. If he can defend anyone, he'll be another second-round steal.

analysis: Withey is one of the best shot blockers in the draft. He doesn't really do much else, but he's a guy who should get 15 minutes a night as a solid backup.

analysis: Portland traded Jerrett to Oklahoma City. He is a stretch four who was one of the top high school players in the country, but as a freshman at Arizona he often came off the bench. So he has more talent than his stats suggest and gives the Thunder another shooting threat.

analysis: The Bucks sent this pick to the Mavs, who then sent it on to Hawks. Ledo has top-10 talent. He's a scoring machine who can really shoot the ball. He slipped after missing the season because the NCAA declared him academically ineligible in addition to numerous off-court issues. If the Hawks can rehabilitate him, he has a chance to be this year's Lance Stephenson.

strengths: Solid fluidity, mobility, and footwork • Skilled offensive player with good touch • Dominated Patriot League, experienced
weaknesses: Lacks explosiveness and quickness • Poor 3-point shooting at 25% • Struggled against higher competition

analysis: Muscala is one of the more skilled players in the draft. I'm surprised he slid this far. Again, the Hawks grabbed a player who should have gone earlier considering the skill set.

weaknesses: Struggles against stronger centers • Needs to build strength • Below the rim athlete
awards: Spanish Cup winner ( 2013 ), Spanish 3rd Division MVP ( 2012 )

analysis: Todorovic is a sleeper. He doesn't play a lot, but he's an excellent rebounder for his position. He plays really hard and has emerging post moves in the paint. He's the perfect draft-and-stash pick.

weaknesses: Lacks ideal size and strength • Below average finisher with contact • Defensive effectiveness questioned

analysis: Neto was the Eurocamp's best guard a few weeks ago. He starts in the ACB, is super quick and really sees the floor well. Another draft-and-stash player.

weaknesses: Below‑average lateral quickness • Struggles finishing through contact • Injury durability concerns
awards: NCAA champion ( 2010 ), McDonald's All-American ( 2009 ), First-team Parade All-American (2009)
analysis: Kelly fits the big man mold Lakers coach Mike D'Antoni loves. He can shoot, can handle the ball and plays with a great basketball IQ. D'Antoni will be able to maximize his talents. It's a great fit for him and the Lakers.

strengths: Excellent floor stretcher with NBA range • Improved defender and rebounder • High offensive efficiency and good passer
weaknesses: Lacks speed and lateral quickness • Poor rebounder despite strength gains • Limited athleticism and vertical leap
awards: First-team All- SEC (2013), Fourth-team Parade All-American (2009)
analysis: Murphy is another of the en vogue stretch 4s. He can really shoot the basketball, and the Bulls can ask him to just spot up in the corners. He doesn't do much else, but his shooting alone makes him a valuable pick.

strengths: High flying athlete with good size • Solid three-point shooter at 36% • Strong, explosive dunker
weaknesses: Lacks a quick first step • Prone to turnovers, averaging 3.0 per game • Played in lower-tier Big West Conference
analysis: The Hawks sent this pick to the Heat, who grabbed one of the sleepers of the draft. Ennis is a big-time athlete who can shoot and play above the rim. His basketball IQ isn't his strong point, but as a raw prospect, he's a good get at 50.

analysis: Osby is a warrior. He lacks elite athleticism and size, but he's the type of undersized big man who gets by with toughness and hustle.

analysis: In Wiggins, the Cavs got the best long-term player in the draft. Joel Embiid might have more upside, but the foot was a risk. Jabari Parker is the most ready now, but he has a limited ceiling. Wiggins has both huge upside and the ability to impact the game now on both ends of the floor. I think this is the right call for the Cavs. Great choice.

strengths: Elite face-up game and post skills • High basketball IQ and playmaking ability • Strong, bulky build with good hands
weaknesses: Defensive skills and positioning uncertain • Slow, hitched shooting release • Questionable perimeter quickness and length

analysis: Parker was the guy the Bucks wanted all along, and the Bucks were the team Parker wanted. The Bucks needed an alpha-dog scorer, and they got him. They will build the team around him. Interestingly, they plan to play Parker at the 4 and Giannis Antetokounmpo at the 3.

analysis: Embiid might be the best player in the draft. The Sixers decided to take the gamble of drafting him at No. 3 even though he will miss 4-6 months after foot surgery. If he's healthy in a year, this could end up as the steal of the draft, and he and Nerlens Noel could be the new version of the "twin towers." But that's a big if. General manager Sam Hinkie is not afraid to gamble.

analysis: This is a bit of a surprise from the Magic. Gordon is a crazy athlete and does all the little things that coaches love. But the Magic lack shooting and needed a point guard. A little surprise here. I love Gordon; I just don't love the fit in Orlando.

analysis: Exum is a huge win for the Jazz. They needed a potential franchise player, and I think they got him. He's so quick, so fast and has such great size for his position. He can play with Trey Burke, or he can, and likely will, eventually take Burke's starting job. It's so hard for the Jazz to lure elite talent. I think they got one here.

analysis: The Celtics were down to Smart and Julius Randle. I love this pick. Smart has the sort of toughness and grit that Danny Ainge loves. I'm not sure what this means for Rajon Rondo. Smart can play with him at the 2-guard, but I suspect this means the Celtics will ramp up efforts to trade Rondo.

analysis: Randle wowed the Lakers in a workout. He's ready to play right now, and they desperately need help in the paint. He was thought of as a potential No. 1 pick at the start of the season but got a little lost in all of Kentucky's talent. He should be a major impact rookie for the Lakers next season.

strengths: Excellent shooter with deep range • Good decision maker and ball handler • Effective in pick and roll situations
